titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Flora and George Herendon, Indictment

body.p:
Campbell Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
John W Flora & Geo Herendon Defendant

The Grand Jury of Campbell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John W Flora & Geo Herendon of the offense of refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter, Committed as follows, viz; The Said John W Flora & George Herendon on the day of August, 1865, and on divers other days and times, before and Since that time, and before the finding of this Indictment, in the County and State aforesaid, were officers of an Election & there held at Carthage Precinct, in Said County, under the Constitution & laws of the State of Kentucky, for the Election
of a member of the Congress of the United States in the 6th Congressional District, a State Treasurer, a Senetor from the 25th Senatorial District, two members of the General Assembly, and a Clerk of the Circuit Court for Said county; The said Flora then & there being a Judge of Said Election; and the Said Herendon being then & there the Sheriff at Said Election, and Severally acting as such, at the time and place aforesaid -- having been duly appointed and qualified as Such Judge & Sheriff; The Jurors aforesaid in the name and by the authority aforesaid, do further say that at the Election aforesaid, and for the purpose aforesaid, at the Precinct -- aforesaid in the County aforesaid, on the day and year aforesaid, Thomas Daniel, a qualified voter of Said Precinct and County, did then & there appear at the Polls before the Judges, Sheriff & Clerk of the Said Election, between the hours of
Seven Oclock A. M., and Six Oclock P, M, and then & there offer to vote, Whereupon the Said John W. Flora & George Herendon, as Judge & Sheriff of Said Election Respectively, did Knowingly and unlawfully refuse to receive of the Said Daniel, Contrary to the Statute in Such Case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

A Copy
Attest Benj Beall clk
Campbell Circuit Court

131
The Commonwealth
Against
John W Flora & Geo Herendon
Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
A True Bill
G. W. Carmack
Foreman
Filed Augs 24th 1865
B. W. issd Aug 28th
